solution_line_template: First take out the cost of the concessions. That leaves ${total_cost} - ${concessions_cost} = $<<{total_cost}-{concessions_cost}={cost_for_tickets}>>{cost_for_tickets} for the movie tickets

Each child ticket costs ${child_ticket_cost}, so two children's tickets cost ${child_ticket_cost} per child ticket * {num_children} child tickets = $<<{child_ticket_cost}*{num_children}={total_child_tickets_cost}>>{total_child_tickets_cost}

To find the amount spent on adult tickets, subtract the cost of the children's tickets to get ${cost_for_tickets} - ${total_child_tickets_cost} = $<<{cost_for_tickets}-{total_child_tickets_cost}={total_adult_tickets_cost}>>{total_adult_tickets_cost} for adult tickets.
Divide ${total_adult_tickets_cost} for adult tickets / {num_adults} adults = $<<{total_adult_tickets_cost}/{num_adults}={cost_per_adult_ticket}>>{cost_per_adult_ticket} per adult ticket.
